result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Jackson in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Michael Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Return on doctor's report held. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
-signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided information to WFU and the parties.

Defendant Michael Jackson in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Michael Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea and sentencing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defendant has scheduled appointment with Dr. Collins on 9-15-2022  at 12:00PM, Room 504 Safety Building. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 15.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jackson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense in receipt of a global offer and requests a plea and sentencing date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.J.C. and N.M.M., 2086 S. 105 St., West Allis, WI; Co-suspect H.H. (DOB 10/01/2001)
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Michael Jackson in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Michael Jackson in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
